Plot Summary

This issue of My Greatest Adventure contains the following three stories:

  • I Was a Modern Hercules!
  • I Was a Test Pilot in Outer Space!
  • We Found the Evolution Man!

It also contains the following comic strip:

  • Planet Og

I Was a Modern Hercules

In a last minute attempt to find a costume for a costume party the man named Perry enters an antique shop. It is here that he is sold a strange Lion Pelt that grants him incredible levels of strength; however, after it is stolen by a criminal named Lastro he'll need more than strength to get it back!

I Was a Test Pilot in Outer Space

It is the year 2347 and a test pilot named Colin is about to test a ship designed specifically to fly to Aquaris, the sea planet! This mission requires a co-pilot due to the nature of the ship, thus he is joined by a man named Larid Drews; however, Larid isn't all he appears to be.

We Found the Evolution Man

Two anthropologists, Mason and Riker, discover a caveman in the 20th century. They take the man in, looking to study him; however, when he begins evolving before their very eyes they realize they might be unable to keep up!

Planet Og

King Og tries to send a spy to Earth with disappointing results.
name: We Found the Evolution Man
Mop-Up Squad

description: Developing a means of time travel, adventurer Rip Hunter travels back to a prehistoric age to share adventures with his friends. In this issue, Rip finds himself back in the year 100 Million B.C.and with the task of facing down a dinosaur who is about to devour his friends Corky and Bonnie. Can Rip not only do that, but return himself and his comrades back to the present?
name: Prisoners of 100 Million B.C.

description:
1. Cover by Curt Swan and Stan Kaye.
  2. "The Ghost of Lois Lane" written by Jerry Coleman, penciled by Wayne Boring and inked by Stan Kaye. Superman inadvertently causes an accident in Professor Grail's lab, which may cost Lois Lane her life. Reprinted in Superman's Girl Friend, Lois Lane #77.
  3. "Clark Kent, Fireman of Steel!" written by Otto Binder, penciled and inked by Al Plastino. Clark Kent joins the Metropolis Fire Department to do a story on fire-fighting, but must do so without revealing that he is Superman. Reprinted in Superman #197.
  4. "The Girl in Superman's Past" (An Untold Tale of Superman) written by Bill Finger, penciled by Wayne Boring and inked by Stan Kaye. Clark meets, dates and proposes to his College sweetheart, Lori Lemaris. Reprinted in Superman Annual #1 & Superman #217.
name: The Ghost Of Lois Lane / Clark Kent Fireman of Steel! / The Girl in Superman's Past!

The Monster Mystery

description:
Before Roger Fleming’s father was killed by Soviet agents, who ran the pair off a lonely country road, he used his secretly developed formula designed to give the recipient access to the unused 90 percent of the brain on the toddler.

Found by a farmer who adopted him, young Roger was given the name Lancelot Strong.

Roger, or Lancelot did not discover his powers until after he had joined the army where he found that along with being incredibly strong he could also develop almost any ability he concentrated on, from flight and “radar sense” to being able to rearrange his molecules to make himself lighter, and so run faster, or as hard as steel, he then dedicated himself to fighting communism as The Shield.

volume.name: The Double Life of Private Strong

name: The Mystery Seeds From Space

description:
Solovar contacts The Flash to help him find Gorilla Grodd, who has sought refuge in the underground world of the Bird-People.

Return of the Super-Gorilla!

Grodd, the amazing ape with the mind of a genius--an evil genius--makes a surprise reappearance to challenge his nemesis, The Flash! And once again, the fastest man alive counts on his super speed to overwhelm his foe--but this time the Flash's speed turns out to be the very means by which Grodd plans to defeat the scarlet speedster!

Amazing Race Against Time!

Who in the world could out strip the fantastically fleet Flash? Go past him as if the Scarlet Speedster was standing still? For the startling and electrifying truth behind the astonishing even -- read-- "The Amazing Race Against Time!"
name: Return of the Super-Gorilla!; The Amazing Race Against Time!

description:
Plot Summary

This issue of My Greatest Adventure contains the following three stories:

  • We Were Trapped in Freak Valley!
  • The Day I Deserted to Earth!
  • We Battled the Hand of Doom!

It also features the following comic strips:

  • Shorty
  • Professor Eureka

We Were Trapped in Freak Valley

A group of big game hunters come across a strange location known as Freak Valley, here the sizes of various animals vary drastically, thus adding an interesting new element to the hunt. Things heat up once they end up the targets of creatures such as a giant porcupine and a mob of bats.

The Day I Deserted to Earth

Lor is an undercover alien cop who has infiltrated a band of criminals. During one of their crimes his ship crash lands on Earth where an old couple take care of him and help restore his health. Lor must then choose between protecting his new-found family or capturing the criminal gang he was assigned to bring in!

We Battled the Hand of Doom

A strange hand from another dimension begins wrecking havoc in the oil town of Mesa-Ville. It's up to Doctor Gaunt and a frantic man named Anderson to defeat the hand and save the town!

Shorty

Shorty gets a tattoo unlike any other.

Professor Eureka

The professor unveils a device he's been working on for the past 20 years!
name: We Battled the Hand of Doom
Gunner's Choice

Plot Summary

This issue of My Greatest Adventure contains the following three stories:

  • I Was Pursued by the Elements!
  • I Fought for Two Planets!
  • I Was Trapped in a Cosmic World!

It also features the following comic strips:

  • Buzzy
  • Peter Puptent

I Was Pursued by the Elements

A band of prospectors travel to Thailand to search for platinum. While they're there, one member of their troupe steals a magical wand from the idol, Bokhara. With the elements against them they must do everything in their power to survive.

I Fought for Two Planets

A human is saved by a group of aliens from Pluto; however, he must turn against his saviors when the Marines launch a full assault against the aliens. Now he's trapped between two sides, both friends to him, but which will he choose?

I Was Trapped in a Cosmic World

Jack, a scientist, is working on a new invention, the Hayden-Ray. When he accidentially slips into the beams path during a trial run he is transported into a new world, a cosmic world, the micro-verse. Here he must fight for his life against a new breed of creatures and beasts.

Buzzy

Buzzy teaches readers about the dangers of rumors.

Peter Puptent

When Peter shaves his face, the locals believe he has found the fountain of youth
name: I Was Trapped in a Cosmic World

description: Travelling back in time, Rip Hunter finds himself in mythological hot water as he faces Circe the enchantress, and her half man / half beast minotaur. Can Rip escape his historical fate and return to the present or will they too be transformed into mythological creatures?
name: The Secret of the Lost Continent

I Was A Prisoner Of The Martians! - (unknown) A film director is kidnapped by Martians while the cast and crew stand by thinking it's part of the film.

Masquerade - (unknown) A text story about a man named Tommy who doesn't like the make-believe.

My Forbidden Paintings! - (unknown) A self-centered painter buys a magic brush, heedless of the curse it's said to have.

I Made Time Stand Still - (unknown) A man invents a machine that stops time.

I Love A Mermaid! - (unknown) A sailor falls in love with a mermaid.

The Man Who Floats In Space! - (Ditko) Captain Racer and the Space Patrol take on Bogane the Martian Space Pirate.

description:
Using his quadromobile, Gorilla Grodd escapes once again from Gorilla City and turns himself into a modern man!

The Speed Of Doom!

Police Forensic scientist, Barry Allen, and Picture News reporter, Iris West, enjoy a Fourth of July picnic. Allen's thoughts are lost on his latest adventure, as the Flash. Under the ruse of measuring his top speed for science, the Flash had allowed himself to be bombarded with a strange radiation, that actually forced him to run. The scientist, who had tricked the Flash, revealed himself to be an alien, Kee Felig of the planet, Mohru. Held in place by the radiation beam, the Flash was forced to run, ever faster, until he would eventually perish. Unbeknownst to the Flash, law enforcement authorities on Mohru were having trouble with lightning-fast thieves.

His every attempt to slow down a failure, the Flash switched tactics by actually increasing his speed. Exceeding the speed of light, the Flash was able to break free of the radiation beam that held him. The Flash's scientific curiosity is drawn to a piece of fulgurite. As the Flash leaned down to collect the Fulgurite, it suddenly disappeared. Investigating further, the Flash learned that several museums, across the country, had reported fulgurite thefts. At one such museum, the Flash witnessed another piece suddenly float away at enormous speed. Matching it's velocity, the Flash saw another speedster carrying the fulgurite away.

The speedster raced into the side of a hill, and vanished. The Flash saw another speedster do the exact same thing. Continuing the pursuit, the Flash raced into the hillside, and found himself breaking the dimensional barrier between Earth and Mohru. Recognizing Kee Felig among the alien speedsters, the Flash took them all down, then turned them over to the authorities. The Flash learned that the aliens were taking any object struck by lightning on Earth, to Mohru. There they drew out the essence of the lightning to give themselves super-speed. As the Flash was the sole being, on either world, who could possibly stop them, they attempted to take him out.

The Super-Gorilla's Secret Identity!

The strangest army imaginable was poised to strike a shattering blow at the Earth! In command was Grodd, a power-mad gorilla with the mind of a genius! Only one man had the chance of stopping Grodd's conquest of Earth--The Flash--but to succeed, the Fastest Man Alive had to discover..."The Super-Gorilla's Secret Identity!"
name: The Speed of Doom! / The Super-Gorilla's Secret Identity!

description:
Marie is an ordinary French farm girl. She grew up listening to tales of high adventure during war as told to her by both her father and grandfather.

By the time she was a woman, France had been invaded by the Germans. Marie and her father joined the Resistance and became Maquis (resistance fighters). Her father died in her arms during their first mission. This left her in command of the local Resistance unit. Marie is both tough and tender.
name: Battle Doll!
